document.name: A Modern European Breakfast by chef Clive Fernandes

custom_questions.question: Number of vegetarians in the group?
Number of non-vegetarians in the group?

document.short_description:
About the Meal


This is not your ordinary breakfast menu. It’s for diners looking to try something novel. Inspired by my time at Toronto’s famed Auberge du Pommier and paying homage to their chef patrons, this menu is crafted with carefully sourced ingredients and modern culinary techniques. Chef Clive Fernandes believes food should go beyond sustenance—it should be an experience. Keeping his core philosophy of simplicity and originality in mind, he crafts dishes that are both familiar yet progressive. What sets your brand apart: Oxalis brings modern European gastronomy to the city; no compromises, no shortcuts—just pure, unadulterated, and modern flavors. At Oxalis, we leave no stone unturned when it comes to ingredients used in each dish, delivering high-end artistic plates and an elevated dining experience.


MENU


NON VEGETARIAN


SAUCISSON EN BRIOCHE

Polish Pork Sausage, Brioche, Port


STEAK & EGGS

Coffee Tenderloin, Onsen Egg, Pomme Persillade (Gluten- free)


SAUMON

Fennel Cured Salmon, WHipped Horseradish Crème, Rye Toast


PASTRAMI DE CANARD

Smoked Muscovy Duck, Butternut Squash, Preserved Berries, Baguette


BACON PAIN PERDU

Spice Roasted. Plums, Creme Fraiche, Grape Molasses, Bacon Lardon, Brioche


QUICHE LORRAINE

Asparagus, Shucked Peas, Parmesan, Pork Ham, Confit Onion


VEGETARIAN


WILD & TAME MUSHROOM TARTINE

Mushroom Mascarpone Pâté, Purslane, Pickles


PANISSE

Torched Cauliflower, Root Vegetable Ketchup, Espelette Harissa, Chickpea Crumble (vegan, gluten- free)


POMME ALIGOT FOUGASSE

Braised Breadfruit & Jackfruit, Swiss Cheese Aligot, Espelette Puffed Quinoa & Potato


RIZ AU LAIT

Rice pudding, Pecan Pralines, Caramel Mousse (vegan, gluten-free)

document.name: The Wonder Years with chefs Ralph & Picu

custom_questions.question: Number of Vegetarians in the Group
Number of Non- Vegetarians in the Group

document.short_description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening celebrating the rich culinary heritage of Goa with two best friends turned culinary stars, Chef Picu and Chef Ralph. These two chefs, now at the forefront of the Goan food scene, have been inseparable since childhood, sharing a bond forged in the vibrant streets of Panjim.


This special dinner menu is an ode to their enduring friendship and the city that has been its backdrop. The dishes showcase the European techniques they've mastered throughout their culinary journeys. The fusion of Portuguese and local influences that define Goan cuisine is beautifully reflected in every bite, each with a contemporary twist that only these talented chefs can create.


Throughout the evening, embark on a culinary journey that feels both modern and nostalgic. The menu draws inspiration from generations-old recipe books of the Gomes Pereira and Prazeres households, infusing the meal with the essence of Goa's rich history.


Experience the magic as these two friends take contemporary Goan cuisine in a new direction, delivering a heartwarming and memorable dining experience that pays tribute to their shared roots and innovative spirit.


Set Menu


NOTE: Seafood allergies & gluten can be accommodated


Non- Veg Menu                                          


Bread Course:

Coriander Chilli Lime/Goan Sausage Butter


Course 1:                                                     

OLMI                                                                    

Grilled morels & truffle.


Course 2:

GRILLED TIGER PRAWNS

Recheado seafood bisque


Course 3:

ROAST BEEF CROQUETTAS

Garlic paprika yoghurt


Course 4:

PAN ROASTED FISH

Kalchi kodi, turmeric mash, onion fennel salad


Course 5:

BEEF TENDERLION

Onion sauce, pepper jus, pomme frittes


COURSE 6:

PASTEIS DE NATA

Portuguese custard tart


Veg Menu  


Bread Course:

Coriander Chilli Lime


Course 1:                                                     

OLMI                                                                    

Grilled morels & truffle


Course 2: 

GRILLED BROCCOLI

Garlic butter & dill yoghurt


Course 3:

JACKFRUIT CROQUETTAS

Garlic paprika yoghurt


Course 4:

GRILLED WHITE ASPARAGUS & PALM HEART

Kalchi kodi, turmeric mash, puffed brown rice


Course 5:

TAMBDI BHAJI LASAGNA

parmesan , goats cheese, caramelised walnuts


Course 6:

PASTEIS DE NATA

Portuguese custard tart

document.name: Mother of All Bake Sales
document.short_description:
Join us for the ultimate bake sale at Courtyard in Bangalore! We are thrilled to host an exceptional lineup of celebrated bakers from across India, each bringing their unique flavors and specialties. Meet and taste the creations of:


  1. Chef Ralph Prazeres from Padaria Prazeres, Goa
  2. Chef Dina Weber from Sapa Bakery, Mysore
  3. Chef Heena Punwani from Maska Bakery, Mumbai
  4. Chef Nida Ali from Market Lane, Chennai


Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to indulge in a variety of delectable baked goods, meet the bakers, and enjoy a day filled with scrumptious treats and delightful conversations. Whether you're a baking enthusiast or just love good food, the "Mother of All Bake Sales" is the place to be!

  • No shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.

  • Children over of the age 3 & above require a ticket.
  • No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.
  • Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.

document.short_description:
Open-air screening with a three-course dinner & popcorn

About the movie:

In "Charlie's Angels" (2000), a high-energy action-comedy, three women—Natalie Cook (Cameron Diaz), Dylan Sanders (Drew Barrymore), and Alex Munday (Lucy Liu)—work as private investigators for the mysterious Charles Townsend, who communicates with them only through a speakerphone. Known collectively as Charlie's Angels, they use their intelligence, beauty, and a wide array of skills to tackle high-stakes missions.


Three-course menu by Chef Mathew


Appetizer

Roasted mixed pepper bruschetta

Mains

Vegetable lasagna

OR

Chicken lasagna

Dessert

Tiramisu


Terms and Conditions:


  1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.

  3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.
  5. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.
  6. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.
  7. In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

account_data.company_description: love.OORU is a tranquil oasis on the rooftop which is the perfect setting for enjoying beautiful sunsets, hosting private dinners & events, and maybe indulging in a chef's table experience.  Taking inspiration from Bengaluru, her history, geography, culture, and most importantly her stories, love.OORU was born as an identity rooted in Bengaluru and all it has to offer.

Would you like to join Love Ooru's whatsapp community to stay updated on upcoming  experiences ? Share your number.

document.short_description:
The Flow of Life Workshop will be conducted by Vasundhra Jain, founder of home decor brand Little Miss Makes.

As part of the workshop, Vasundhra aims to create an experience that will allow people to explore their deep emotions. No fixed boundaries, no lines to colour within, just a blank canvas some plaster and your imagination.


Details:

• The participants will be given 2 canvases to work with, in case 1 gets ruined they always have another try.

• ⁠The workshop will run for 2.5 hours, providing enough time for the artwork to dry to touch.

• All materials will be provided by the artist, the attendees need only bring their smile and a happy attitude.

default_section.label: What's included
default_section.text:
✨All the materials will be provided. 
A welcome drink  (non-alcoholic)

default_section.text: Food and Beverages can be ordered from our menu

document.name: intro to letterpress
document.short_description:
A workshop to get to know about letterpress

- history, process and craft of printing by hand on an antique press.

The session will focus on hand setting the metal type the old fashioned way,

making a composition and printing your own piece of typographic art.


Beginner level workshop.

No prior experience required

document.name: Letterpress poster printing
document.short_description:
The art of poster making with your own hands. A fun session to unleash your creative minds, experiment with typographic layout and using types.


Bring along a favourite quote, song lyric or poem perhaps and with our guidance, you can make a fabulous poster print for your wall. We recommend no more than 5 words.


Details

- Create a poster / print for your wall

- Suitable for graphic designers, design enthusiasts, printmakers, type lovers, anyone who wants to create a print with your own hands

All materials required would be provided. You will make two copies of the poster print in A4 size.
